alert.note: Alert for Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 08 at 10:46PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...The following areas, the northeast Gulf Coast and portions of the northern Inner Channels. This includes the cities of Yakutat, Skagway, And Haines. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of low-lying areas and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with snow. Mariners should be monitor their vessels for proper water drainage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Moderate to heavy rainfall has already begun across the region and will persist through Wednesday afternoon around Yakutat, Skagway, and Haines. Tuesday rainfall amounts have already ranged up to 1 inch in Upper Lynn Canal and 1 to 2.5 inches for the northeast Gulf Coast. Additional rainfall amounts of up to 1.5 inch are expected through Wednesday evening. Rain on the snowpack will increase the runoff and may result in ponding of water on roads and low lying areas.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway
